Market Data Engine

The MarketDataEngine class is responsible for collecting, processing, and storing market data for cryptocurrency options.

class core.MarketDataEngine.MarketDataEngine(exchange_api, vol_engine, settings=Settings(STORAGE=StorageConfig(STORAGE_TYPE=<StorageType.POSTGRES: 'postgres'>, ARCTIC_URI='lmdb://tmp/trading_data', POSTGRES_URI='postgresql://mikeb:postgres@localhost:5432/optionsdb'), MONEYNESS_RANGE=(0.8, 1.2), DAYS_TO_EXPIRY_RANGE=(2, 20)), currency='ETH', asset_type='crypto', asset_id=0)[source]

Bases: object

A class for managing market data collection, processing, and storage for cryptocurrency options.

This engine is responsible for: - Initializing and maintaining a list of active instruments - Collecting market data at regular intervals - Processing and calculating volatility surfaces - Storing market data and derived analytics

settings

Configuration settings for the engine

Type:

Settings

exchange_api

API interface for the exchange

Type:

DeribitAPI

vol_engine

Engine for volatility calculations

Type:

VolatilityEngine

currency

The cryptocurrency being monitored (e.g., “BTC”, “ETH”)

Type:

str

asset_type

Type of asset (default: “crypto”)

Type:

str

asset_id

Unique identifier for the asset

Type:

int

max_retries

Maximum number of retry attempts for failed operations

Type:

int

min_expiry_days

Minimum days to expiry for monitored options

Type:

int

max_expiry_days

Maximum days to expiry for monitored options

Type:

int

min_moneyness

Minimum moneyness ratio for monitored options

Type:

float

max_moneyness

Maximum moneyness ratio for monitored options

Type:

float

async get_last_price()[source]

Fetch the current price of the underlying asset.

Returns:

The current price of the underlying asset

Return type:

float

Raises:

ValueError – If unable to get the current price

async initialize_instruments()[source]

Initialize the set of instruments to monitor.

This method: - Fetches the current price of the underlying asset - Retrieves available options from the exchange - Filters options based on expiry and moneyness criteria - Updates the active instruments set

Returns:

None

async process_market_updates()[source]

Process market updates for all active instruments.

This method coordinates the main data collection and processing cycle: - Checks market state - Processes currency updates - Updates last update timestamp - Handles any errors that occur during processing

Returns:

None

Raises:

Exception – If any error occurs during processing

async run(interval_minutes=5)[source]

Main entry point for the market data worker.

Parameters:

interval_minutes (int) – Time in minutes between each processing cycle

This method: - Initializes instruments - Runs continuous processing loop - Handles scheduling and error recovery - Manages graceful shutdown

Returns:

None

async core.MarketDataEngine.main()[source]

Market Data Processing

async MarketDataEngine.process_market_updates()[source]

Process market updates for all active instruments.

This method coordinates the main data collection and processing cycle: - Checks market state - Processes currency updates - Updates last update timestamp - Handles any errors that occur during processing

Returns:

None

Raises:

Exception – If any error occurs during processing

async MarketDataEngine._process_currency_updates()[source]

Process updates for the current currency.

This method: - Fetches the current price - Gets the options chain - Calculates the volatility surface - Stores the collected and calculated data

Returns:

None

Instrument Management

async MarketDataEngine.initialize_instruments()[source]

Initialize the set of instruments to monitor.

This method: - Fetches the current price of the underlying asset - Retrieves available options from the exchange - Filters options based on expiry and moneyness criteria - Updates the active instruments set

Returns:

None

MarketDataEngine._get_options_chain()[source]

Collect and process options chain data for active instruments.

Returns:

DataFrame containing options chain data with columns:

  • timestamp: Time of data collection

  • symbol: Option instrument identifier

  • strike: Strike price

  • expiry_date: Option expiration date

  • option_type: Put or Call

  • last_price: Last traded price

  • implied_vol: Implied volatility

  • greeks: Delta, Gamma, Vega, Theta

  • other market data

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Volatility Surface

MarketDataEngine._get_vol_surface(option_chain)[source]

Generate the volatility surface from options chain data.

Parameters:

option_chain (pd.DataFrame) – Options chain data

Returns:

Object containing the calculated volatility surface,

including term structure and skew information

Return type:

VolatilitySurface
